fields.label_info_title: Does the child show any warning signs, indicating a potential developmental delay?
fields.label_info_text:
The different warning signs per age group are:  
● 0-1 month: the baby shows little movement of arms and legs or little or no reaction to loud sounds or bright lights  
● 0-6 months: the child shows little or no response to sounds, familiar faces or breast, or shows stiffness or difficulty moving limbs
● 6-12 months: the child does not look at objects that move or shows listlessness and lack of response to the caregiver
● 12-24 months: the child has difficulty to keep balance while walking or has injuries or unexplained changes in behavior
● 24-36 months: the child shows loss of interest in playing, frequently falls and has difficulties in manipulating small objects
● 36-59 months: the child shows excessive aggression or shyness with friends and family or has trouble communicating needs, thoughts and emotions
fields.hint: Does the child show any warning signs, indicating a potential developmental delay?

fields.label_info_title: Does the caregiver show attitudes and knowledge on stimulation and nurturing care?
fields.label_info_text:
Specific attitudes and knowledge on stimulation and nurturing care per age group are:  
     ● 0-1 week: the caregiver engages in skin to skin contact, looks into baby’s eyes and communicates to the child
     ● 0-6 months: the caregiver moves colorful things for the child to see, smiles, talks and copies the child's sounds and gestures
     ● 6-9 months: the caregiver gives clean and safe household things to play with, responds to the child's sounds and calls the child's name to see if the child responds
     ● 9-12 months: the caregiver hides toys (peek-a-boo) and tells the child names of things and people
     ● 12-24 months: the caregiver gives the child things to stack up and asks the child simple questions
     ● 2 years and older: the caregiver makes simple toys for the child, teaches stories, songs and games to the child
fields.hint: Does the caregiver show attitudes and knowledge on stimulation and nurturing care?
Is the child regularly attending an early learning program (formal or not formal)?
